text: Breath of the Wild had such an amazing sense of scale and adventuring. I remember seeing Rito Village from super far away and deciding to head straight for it. It felt like a journey, going through various terrain obstacles and monsters, spending many nights by the fire outside, and then finally arriving at the destination. As you approach, you slowly start hearing the soothing village theme as if it's welcoming you after the harsh road (and as a bonus, a rendition of Wind Waker's Dragon Roost Island). BOTW is all about these kind of moments.
author: SupraDarky

text: totally agree good choice good choice
author: TKG

text: Lovely description of the experience ^^

text: One of the most beautiful songs Nintendo has ever produced. Period.
author: Andrew B

text: It's strange. Breath of the wild had a marvellous atmosphere that lingered in my thoughts for days or even weeks after playing. Music contributed to that greatly, and yet, the tracks aren't nearly as catchy as in the past. They're great, but completely forgettable somehow. And yet to this day, I can still recall tracks from the older games by heart and hum them during my day. Anyone else feel this way? Why do you think this happens?
author: Auralan

text: Nostalgia probably. The games from the past probably imprinted on you as a child so you remember those more.  I am the same way.
author: DaimoMusic

text: Simpler melodies, less instruments, something like that...
author: Fak Yuh Googel

text: This game also went for that style of soundtrack, it isn't as bombastic and in your face, now it takes the backseat and builds the environment. But honestly, I remember these songs well enough, especially this one
author: Bubbles, the monkey from DBZ

text: I think the adventurous atmosphere of games like twilight princess and wind waker had a pretty big impact on my childhood along with their upbeat soundtracks. Botw's soundtrack is great nonetheless but it feels like its trying to blend in with the atmosphere itself rather than acting as bgm. A lot of the tracks have a calm ambience to them which fits with the setting of the story so I guess it was intended that way. Like this song as an example being a chilled out version of dragon roost island lol
author: TKG

text:
Is it backtracking? OOT was really small, and you had to visit some places multiple times (and I've completed those games like twenty times...) 

I haven't played the game yet, but this game has my favourite Zelda OST! Probably because it's so atmospheric!
author: garfreeek
